page.title: 18Transport in Elsworth
page.content:
There is no daily bus service from the village and so a car is needed for work. There are buses on certain days to Cambridge, Huntingdon and St. Ives which makes it possible to use public transport for shopping. The services are provided by Whippet Coaches of Fenstanton.
The lack of transport makes it particularly difficult for young people going to work and so most have motor bikes. The County Council provides transport for Junior children coming into Elsworth and for secondary children attending Swavesey Village College.
It would be difficult to live in Elsworth without a car, and this presents problems for old or poor people.
